columns.name: name
columns.description: The name that you assign to the AWS Config rule.

columns.name: rule_id
columns.description: The ID of the AWS Config rule.

columns.name: arn
columns.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Config rule.

columns.name: rule_state
columns.description: It indicate the evaluation status for the AWS Config rule.

columns.name: created_by
columns.description: Service principal name of the service that created the rule.

columns.name: description
columns.description: The description that you provide for the AWS Config rule.

columns.name: maximum_execution_frequency
columns.description: The maximum frequency with which AWS Config runs evaluations for a rule.

columns.name: compliance_by_config_rule
columns.description: The compliance information of the config rule.

columns.name: evaluation_modes
columns.description: The modes the Config rule can be evaluated in. The valid values are distinct objects. By default, the value is Detective evaluation mode only.

columns.name: input_parameters
columns.description: A string, in JSON format, that is passed to the AWS Config rule Lambda function.

columns.name: scope
columns.description: Defines which resources can trigger an evaluation for the rule. The scope can include one or more resource types, a combination of one resource type and one resource ID, or a combination of a tag key and value. Specify a scope to constrain the resources that can trigger an evaluation for the rule. If you do not specify a scope, evaluations are triggered when any resource in the recording group changes.

columns.name: source
columns.description: Provides the rule owner (AWS or customer), the rule identifier, and the notifications that cause the function to evaluate your AWS resources.

columns.name: tags_src
columns.description: A list of tags assigned to the rule.
